title: Bachelorette: Jess Glasgow's new girlfriend revealed as Mandy Lopez
text:
Eliminated Bachelorette contestant Jess Glasgow is facing heavy backlash and death threats after his 'creepy' behaviour towards Angie Kent and crew members on the reality show.

But the 37-year-old has said that his one source of support has been his new girlfriend.

And Daily Mail Australia can reveal that woman is Mandy Lopez, who he met not long after filming the series.

By his side: Eliminated Bachelorette contestant Jess Glasgow (left) has a new girlfriend Many Lopez (middle). This photo was posted to her Instagram three weeks ago

Mandy appears to be quiet with her love life on her Instagram page, with only one photo of Jess and her together, which was posted three weeks ago.

The couple posed for a happy snap next to an unknown female at Miss Moneypenny's bar and restaurant in Noosa.

The dark-haired beauty has worked for a number of companies as a graphic artist.

Busy woman: Mandy has worked for a number of companies as a freelance graphic artist including Bauer, Fairfax, Seafolly and Australia Zoo (pictured in the uniform)

Support: Jess has labelled the brunette beauty as 'his light at the end of the tunnel', but wouldn't be surprised if she left him after she 'cringed' watching his short stint on The Bachelorette

According to her Facebook and LinkedIn page, she previously worked at Bauer, Fairfax, Seafolly and Australia Zoo and continues to do freelance work.

On Friday, Jess described Mandy as his 'light at the end of the tunnel', but admitted that she 'cringed' at some of his behaviour during his short stint on The Bachelorette.

'I wouldn't be surprised if she left me. It's not the kind of attention you want. If I were her, I would leave me,' he added.

'The worst side of me was shown': Jess has no plans to resign and end his political career, despite calls from the Noosa mayor and public

When asked why an up-and-coming politician would appear on a dating show, Jess said he saw it as an opportunity to find a partner.

'I'm pretty time poor so I decided to go on TV and went into the experience with an open heart,' he said.

'I kind of wanted to show my good side, but the worst side of me was shown. I've never seen that side of me before.'

Jess said he is fearing for his life after receiving 'death threats' following his controversial appearance on The Bachelorette.

The local Noosa councillor, who was branded 'creepy' and 'disgusting' for his predatory behaviour around Angie, told Daily Mail Australia that someone had emailed him anonymously saying they would 'run him over'.

Inappropriate: On Thursday night's episode of The Bachelorette, Jess joked that Angie was going to 'ride' him and brazenly told her he 'might get some wandering fingers'

'It's very serious. I had a guy email me saying, "I know you ride a scooter and if I see you on your scooter, I'll run you over",' he said.

The 37-year-old has also received threatening phone calls from people warning him 'never to show his face in south east Queensland ever again'.

Over the past 24 hours, he has faced calls to resign from Noosa Mayor Tony Wellington, who has described his behaviour on The Bachelorette as 'misogynistic' and 'highly offensive'.

His is also under investigation for a potential breach of conduct as a result of his behaviour on the dating show. The matter has been referred to the Office of the Independent Assessor.

While there have been calls for him to resign following his actions, Jess has no plans to end his political career.

'None of us thought Donald Trump would be elected either,' he said of Friday, hinting that he will defend his position at re-election.

Booted out: He was eventually told to leave by Bachelorette Angie Kent after she found out about his behaviour towards the crew

On Thursday night's episode of The Bachelorette, Jess joked that Angie was going to 'ride' him and brazenly told her he 'might get some wandering fingers'.

Later in the episode, he called Angie a 'b**ch*' after being told she wanted to speak to him about his inappropriate behaviour on set.

He was then swiftly booted from the mansion by former Gogglebox star Angie.
description: Eliminated Bachelorette contestant Jess Glasgow is facing heavy backlash and death threats after his 'creepy' behaviour on the reality show.
authors: Shive Prema For Daily Mail Australia
